fields.physical_description:
Woven and brocaded silk and metal thread, satin ground, twill binding.
Large central panel, 166.5 cm x 108 cm, containing a lobed arch within which is an elongated cypress tree balanced on an ornamental base shaped like an hour glass.  Both tree and base have a green ground with gold metal thread patterns.  The base has a few scrolling leaves and the tree contains a lozenge shaped lattice formed by leaves and a rosette.  Each compartment contains a right-facing boteh.  The tree is edged with flame-like leaves and terminates in a lotus like flower.  The ground of the arch/niche is a densely packed small floral sprig in gold metal on a red ground and the lobed outline of the arch is formed by a wide band of gold metal thread; it also terminates in a large lotus like flower.  The spandrels have a green ground with a small lattice pattern in gold metal thread, each compartment contains a 4-petalled flower head.  There are 6 borders.  From the inside:
[1] undecorated gold metal thread
[2] a chevron pattern with silver chevrons.  Along the bottom part has worn away so it appears to be silver chevrons alternating with red satin.  Down both sides the chevrons alternate between a geometric pattern with pale orange details and a floral pattern on red satin.  Across the top there is a simple striped chevron with pale pink and a floral pattern.  In the centre of this part of the border is a cartouche with a woven inscription. The cartouche is 16.5 cm wide. In each of the lower corners of this border is a small square with the green ground pattern from the spandrels.
[3] as [1
[4] blue ground with single botehs inward facing along the bottom, outward facing on the other  sides.
[5] red ground with a rosette and leaf meander-like pattern.
[6] as [1].

Warps: red silk, indeterminable twist.
Weft: red silk foundation weft, indeterminable twist; pattern wefts: blue silk, Z twist, green, pale orange and pale pink silk all indeterminable twist.
Metal thread: silver strip close Z-wound around white silk, Z twist and silver-gilt strip close Z-wound around deep yellow Z twist silk.
fields.materials_techniques: silk thread, metal thread, weaving, brocading
